Source code for api.serializers

from rest_framework import serializers
from .models import (
    Activity, Workout, Exercise, AppUser, AppUserInfo, ActivityPlan,
    WorkoutExercise, AppUserCurrentActivityPlan, AppUserActivityPlanHistory, AppUserGoals,
    Affiliate, AffiliatePromotion, AffiliatePromotionDiscountCode, AffiliatePromotionRedemption
)

# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 1. Define the most basic serializer first so other serializers can nest it.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class ExerciseSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    class Meta:
        model = Exercise
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 2. WorkoutExerciseSerializer: Nest the related Exercise using ExerciseSerializer.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class WorkoutExerciseSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    exercise = ExerciseSerializer(read_only=True)  # <-- nested representation of Exercise
    isCompleted = serializers.BooleanField(default=False)  # NEW: Ensure key is always present

    class Meta:
        model = WorkoutExercise
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 3. WorkoutSerializer: Replace the default "exercises" field with a nested field
# using the through model (workoutexercise_set) to capture extra details.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class WorkoutSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Use the reverse relation "workoutexercise_set" to show full details
    workoutexercises = WorkoutExerciseSerializer(many=True, read_only=True, source='workoutexercise_set')

    class Meta:
        model = Workout
        # Exclude the original "exercises" field and use our nested workoutexercises instead.
        fields = ['id', 'name', 'description', 'duration', 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'workoutexercises']




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 4. ActivitySerializer: Nest the foreign key "associated_workout" using the updated WorkoutSerializer.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class ActivitySerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    associated_workout = WorkoutSerializer(read_only=True)  # <-- nested full workout details

    class Meta:
        model = Activity
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 5. ActivityPlanSerializer: (Remains largely the same, already nesting ActivitySerializer.)
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class ActivityPlanSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Nesting ActivitySerializer in each day-field to return full details
    monday_activities    = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)
    tuesday_activities   = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)
    wednesday_activities = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)
    thursday_activities  = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)
    friday_activities    = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)
    saturday_activities  = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)
    sunday_activities    = ActivitySerializer(many=True, read_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = ActivityPlan
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 6. AppUserInfoSerializer: (Remains the same.)
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class AppUserInfoSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    user = serializers.CharField(source="user.phone", read_only=True)
    
    class Meta:
        model = AppUserInfo
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 7. AppUserActivityPlanHistorySerializer: Nest the many-to-many field using ActivityPlanSerializer.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class AppUserActivityPlanHistorySerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    user = serializers.CharField(source="user.phone", read_only=True)
    completed_activity_plans = ActivityPlanSerializer(many=True, read_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = AppUserActivityPlanHistory
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 8. AppUserCurrentActivityPlanSerializer: Nest the related ActivityPlan.
# (We leave the "user" field as is to avoid circular references.)
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class AppUserCurrentActivityPlanSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    user = serializers.CharField(source="user.phone", read_only=True)
    activity_plan = ActivityPlanSerializer(read_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = AppUserCurrentActivityPlan
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 9. AppUserGoalsSerializer: (No nested relations here, but you could nest user if desired.)
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class AppUserGoalsSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    user = serializers.CharField(source="user.phone", read_only=True)
    
    class Meta:
        model = AppUserGoals
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 10. AppUserSerializer: Nest one-to-one and reverse relationships so that user data
# includes full nested details.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class AppUserSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    info = AppUserInfoSerializer(read_only=True)
    current_activity_plan = AppUserCurrentActivityPlanSerializer(read_only=True)
    activity_plan_history = AppUserActivityPlanHistorySerializer(read_only=True)
    goals = AppUserGoalsSerializer(read_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = AppUser
        fields = '__all__'




# --------------------------------------------------------------------
# 11. Affiliate Serializers: New affiliate related serializers.
# --------------------------------------------------------------------


[docs]
class AffiliateSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    class Meta:
        model = Affiliate
        fields = '__all__'






[docs]
class AffiliatePromotionSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Read: provide nested Affiliate details.
    affiliate = AffiliateSerializer(read_only=True)
    # Write: allow setting the affiliate by its primary key.
    affiliate_id = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(source='affiliate', queryset=Affiliate.objects.all(), write_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = AffiliatePromotion
        fields = ['id', 'affiliate', 'affiliate_id', 'title', 'description', 'max_uses', 'uses_remaining', 'start_date', 'end_date', 'is_active']






[docs]
class AffiliatePromotionDiscountCodeSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Read: provide nested representation of the promotion.
    affiliate_promotion = AffiliatePromotionSerializer(read_only=True)
    # Write: allow setting the promotion by its primary key.
    affiliate_promotion_id = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(source='affiliate_promotion', queryset=AffiliatePromotion.objects.all(), write_only=True)
    
    class Meta:
        model = AffiliatePromotionDiscountCode
        fields = ['id', 'code', 'affiliate_promotion', 'affiliate_promotion_id', 'is_used']






[docs]
class AffiliatePromotionRedemptionSerializer(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Read: provide nested promotion details.
    promotion = AffiliatePromotionSerializer(read_only=True)
    # Write: allow setting the promotion with its primary key.
    promotion_id = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(source='promotion', queryset=AffiliatePromotion.objects.all(), write_only=True)
    # Read: represent the user by their phone number.
    user = serializers.CharField(source='user.phone', read_only=True)
    # Write: allow setting the user by its primary key.
    user_id = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(source='user', queryset=AppUser.objects.all(), write_only=True)

    class Meta:
        model = AffiliatePromotionRedemption
        fields = ['id', 'promotion', 'promotion_id', 'user', 'user_id', 'redeemed_at']
